title: GraalVM image - wrong folder permissions
body:
### Description
As an developer, I want to run GraalVM image on Kubernetes under non-root user so that I use less system resources.

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. Create quorum-test-network
2. in .env, put `BESU_VERSION=22.4-graalvm`
3. run `./run.sh`
4. run `docker exec network_validator_1_1 ls -alh /opt`, that'll be `<output1>`
5. run `./remove.sh`
6. in .env, put `BESU_VERSION=22.4`
7. run `./run.sh`
8. run `docker exec network_validator_1_1 ls -alh /opt`, that'll be `<output2>`

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

In `<output1>` and `<output2>`, expect that besu directory has same permissions.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

In `<output1>` (GraalVM), output is:

```
$ docker exec network_validator1_1 ls -alh /opt/
total 20K
drwxr-xr-x  1 root root 4.0K Apr 22 12:31 .
drwxr-xr-x  1 root root 4.0K Apr 22 12:31 ..
drwx------  1 besu besu 4.0K Apr 22 12:32 besu
drwxr-xr-x 10 root root 4.0K Feb 21 11:28 graalvm-ce-java11-22.0.0.2
```

and in `<output2>` (OpenJDK), output is:

```
$ docker exec network_validator1_1 ls -alh /opt/
total 16K
drwxr-xr-x 1 root root 4.0K Apr  4 17:59 .
drwxr-xr-x 1 root root 4.0K Apr 22 12:37 ..
drwxr-xr-x 1 besu besu 4.0K Apr 22 12:37 besu
```

This means that GraalVM image can only be run by besu user (id=1000), while OpenJDK image can be run by any user.

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: 22.4
* OS Name & Version: Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS (Focal Fossa)
* Kernel Version: 5.10.102.1-microsoft-standard-WSL2
* Docker Version: 20.10.14
